it.polito.dp2.NFFG

Interface NffgReader

  • All Superinterfaces:
    NamedEntityReader

    public interface NffgReader
extends NamedEntityReader
    An interface for reading the data associated with a Network Function-Forwarding Graph (NF-FG). An NF-FG is a data structure representing virtual and physical network functions, end-hosts and servers (generically named network nodes), and connections (links) of the network topology. The name associated with this interface uniquely identifies the NF-FG.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      NodeReader getNode(java.lang.String name)
      Gives access to a single network node given its name (a node is uniquely identified in the NF-FG by its name).
      java.util.Set<NodeReader> getNodes()
      Gives access to the set of network nodes of this NF-FG.
      java.util.Calendar getUpdateTime()
      Gives the date and time of the last update of the NF-FG.

      • Methods inherited from interface it.polito.dp2.NFFG.NamedEntityReader

        getName

    • Method Detail

      • getUpdateTime

        java.util.Calendar getUpdateTime()
        Gives the date and time of the last update of the NF-FG.
        Returns:
        the date and time when the NF-FG was last updated.

      • getNodes

        java.util.Set<NodeReader> getNodes()
        Gives access to the set of network nodes of this NF-FG.
        Returns:
        a set of interfaces for accessing information about the network nodes of this NF-FG.

      • getNode

        NodeReader getNode(java.lang.String name)
        Gives access to a single network node given its name (a node is uniquely identified in the NF-FG by its name).
        Parameters:
        name - the node name (a string made of alphanumeric characters only, where the first character is alphabetic).
        Returns:
        an interface for accessing information about the network node with the given name or null if this node is not present in the NF-FG.
